title: Ticket #6230: Poor built-in default for ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR
description:
The default condor_config file ships with the meta-knob "use security:host_based", which sets ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR equal to the reasonable default of $(CONDOR_HOST).

However, if the admin decides to remove this meta-knob from their config file for some reason, ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR will become unset, and an empty ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR is handled as if it were "*", which is not good default behavior.

Propose that the param table be modified so if ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR is unset for any reason, it will default to $(CONDOR_HOST).
